resources.string: Branko Bajcetic is a developer attending Computing Science at Simon Fraser University in Surrey, B.C, Canada. This game is a project for SFU\'s Software Engineering (CMPT 276) course. Webpage: https://opencoursehub.cs.sfu.ca/jackt/grav-cms/cmpt276/home

The goal of Mine Seeker is to find all of the mines in the least amount of guesses. Clicking on a square will uncover whether that square is a mine or not, and how many hidden mines there are within the column and row of that square. When a mine is found, all squares in that mine\'s row and column will have their numbers decremented by one, as there is one less hidden mine. Once all mines are found/clicked, you completed the game and your score will be shown.\n\n Go to the Options screen to change the board size and the number of mines to set a high score for each configuration!
